alert.note: Alert for Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Southern Inner Channels (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 08 at 11:35PM AKST until January 09 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 13 inches, with greatest amounts north of Coffman Cove. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Petersburg, Wrangell, Kake, Point Baker, Whale Pass, Coffman Cove, Thorne Bay, Hollis, and Kasaan. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Winds could down trees and cause power outages. Heavy, wet snow will be difficult to manage. Ponding could develop after a changeover to rain. In areas of deep snow pack, additional snow and a changeover to rain could challenge load bearing ability of roof- tops, boats, and aircraft. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The Ketchikan area saw 6 to 10 inches of snow and has changed to rain as of 10 pm, but temperatures remain below freezing further north in Thorne Bay and on the Prince of Wales Island road system. A change to all rain is expected on Sunday for most elsewhere. There is a chance of freezing rain before the change over.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
